plan.title: JSON Plan for [object Object]
plan.description: This plan describes the steps to create an interactive JSON object.

steps.title: Fetch initial data
steps.instructions: Use your preferred API to fetch some initial data that will be used as the starting point for our [object Object]. For example, you could use an API like JSONPlaceholder to get a random user or post.

response.title: sunt aut facere
response.body:
quia et suscipit
suscipit repellat provident sapiente officiis consequatur

steps.title: Parse and store the data
steps.instructions: Parse the response received in step 1 into a JavaScript object. Store this object temporarily as the starting point for our [object Object].

steps.title: Add new properties to the object
steps.instructions: Based on your requirements, add new properties and values to the stored JavaScript object. For example, you could add a 'timestamp' property that records when the object was created.

steps.title: Validate and format data
steps.instructions: Perform any necessary validation or formatting on the properties of your [object Object]. For example, you could convert a date property into a more user-friendly format.

steps.title: Convert the object to JSON
steps.instructions: Finally, convert your JavaScript object back into a JSON string.

steps.title: Print or store the JSON
steps.instructions: Either print out your JSON string for inspection, or store it in a variable to use later.
